events.title: Battle of the Milvian Bridge
events.description: Constantine the Great defeats Maxentius, leading to his sole control over the Roman Empire. Before the battle, Constantine reportedly had a vision that led him to adopt the Christian cross as his standard.
events.significance: This victory paved the way for the Christianization of the Roman Empire.

events.title: Opening of the New York City Subway
events.description: The first underground line of the New York City Subway officially opens, revolutionizing urban transportation in one of the world's largest cities.
events.significance: It marked the beginning of a vast public transportation system that transformed urban life in New York City.

events.title: Walt Disney World Opens in Florida
events.description: The Magic Kingdom theme park at Walt Disney World Resort opens to the public, becoming a major destination for tourism and entertainment.
events.significance: It established a new model for theme parks and significantly impacted global entertainment culture.

events.title: Saudi Journalist Jamal Khashoggi Murdered
events.description: Journalist Jamal Khashoggi was killed inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, leading to international outcry and diplomatic strain involving Saudi Arabia.
events.significance: The incident highlighted issues of press freedom and geopolitical tensions regarding human rights abuses.
